subject: Football
Concussions
organizations: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L.’s executive vice president for football operations said Monday that dangerous hits to head could earn players harsh penalties, including suspensions, even for first-time offenders.
snippet: The N.F.L.’s executive vice president for football operations said Monday that dangerous hits to head could earn players harsh penalties, including suspensions, even for first-time offenders.
